column2: Jail, it's a cold dark place. And you've been here a while. Problem with not playing by the rules.
*door opens, guard appears.* Todays your lucky day someone wants you free'd.
Arrested for speaking my mind. Guess that's how society is now...
column5: The bed is dingy and stained
The guard seems to want you to follow

column2: You walk down a long hallway. You can hear other prisoners shuffling around in their cells
column5: The hallway is dark with cells lining either side

column2: You reach an elevator. The guard motions you to walk inside. You do. The elevator is dimly lit. The guard hits 1
column5: The elevator is rickety and old looking

column2: *Ding* "We're here, walk up to the counter" says the guard
column5: The guard seems to want you to walk forward

column2: You approach a counter. Another  guard is sitting behind the counter. "Walk to the counter and collect your things" says the guard.
column5: The counter is dimly lit, there are boxes of peoples belongings behind the guard at the counter.

column2: "Please state your government ID number" says the guard behind the counter.
column5: The guard behind the counter seems testy, maybe don’t mess with him.

column2: *The guard walks towards the back and comes back with a box* "Take your stuff" says the guard
column3: [1911 .22, govphone, switchplade, abc headphones, car keys 1, gum, backpack, ID, dirty jeans, tennis shoes, Led Zeppelin Shirt, Braves cap]
column5: !1911 .22, govphone, switchplade, abc headphones, car keys 1, gum, backpack, ID, dirty jeans, tennis shoes, Led Zeppelin Shirt, Braves cap added

column2: *The guard walks towards the back and comes back with nothing "Looks like you had nothing on you" says the guard
column5: It seems like you said the wrong ID, you remember having stuff on you

column2: "You took your stuff now go" says the guard. You are ushered through a series of gates and arrive in a dingy parking lot
column5: It's raining. You can see the lights of downtown in the distance. Closer you can see the stacks, the slum

column2: The parking lot is small with a couple of cars. None of them appear to be yours. You can see the slums nearby and there seems to be a bus stop right by the parking lot.
column5: You should probably walk towards the bus stop, you need to get back to your apartment.

column2: You arrive at the bus stop. After a couple of minutes, a bus arrives, saying "ELM STREET STACKS" you cant seem to remember where you need to go
column4: 14, get on bus|15, stay at stop
column5: You cant quite remember where you live. Might be good to go, would jog your memory maybe

column2: You get on the bus and sit down after swiping your government ID. You sit and watch the rain fall. The bus leaves the stop after a couple of minutes
You wait a while. Finally another bus appears with the same stop information.
column5: You should probably just get on this bus, seems to be the only option

column2: The bus drives for a while before stopping in a badly lit street with tall and rickity apartment buildings. "Get off the bus, this is the last stop" says the driver.
column5: The street outside the bus seems to be in a run down area. The apartments are mostly dark with only a few lights on

column2: You walk off. Down the road a little ways you see a sign pointing to a bar. Down the road the other way you see a homeless person leaning against a building
column4: 18, go to bar|19, talk to homeless person
